website_summaries.verdict: Look cool and also know your money's invested in a solid pair of earbuds that enhance music and gaming.
pros: We love that these earbuds come with multiple color options
Known for their ability to deliver a spectrum of sound ranges with quality and consistency
Ideal for music, gaming and entertainment, where sound is a key element of the experience and enhanced by movie-theater quality sound
cons: May not stand the test of time

customer_reviews.title: Very low quality & break fast!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to have a backup for traveling. Right out the box they sounded TERRIBLE (not like other skull candy earbuds I've bought at Walmart) the sound quality is like when you record a song on your phone from the radio to make it your ringtone. TRASH! No bass at all. And the cherry on top...the left earbud stopped working after about 10 hours of use!!! I want to say these are a cheap fake look alike because the last pair i had bought of these (from Walmart) were fine. Those never broke I just forgot them on a plane. Would not recommend buying these from this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: not real skullcandy headphones
customer_reviews.text: i’m extremely disappointed with this purchase because these are obvious skullcandy ripoffs.. the sound quality is terrible compared to genuine skullcandy... as shown in the picture there is no indication on which ear bud goes into which ear and if you’ve ever owned a pair of skullcandy headphones they always have the “R” and “L”... i’ve never had issues before with buying Skullcandy headphones before at a lower price... i’m hoping to get a refund or genuine Skullcandy headphones sent and if that is done i will post a separate review with a 5 star rating
customer_reviews.author: Jared Kinney

customer_reviews.title: sketchy sound quality
customer_reviews.text: Not sure these are much better than my broken skullcandy earbuds of the same style from a year ago. bought another pair for my wife and the packages are ever so slightly different. hers has the Copyright next to the Skullcandy name on the back of the package. Mine does not. So could be different variations of a similar product, but questionable.
customer_reviews.author: brandon peters

customer_reviews.title: 1 Month Old and Broken Already
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for a little over a month, and they already broke inside. They didn’t fit as good as the ones I would get from the store but I gave them the benefit of the doubt. I had my old skullcandy’s for more than a year and I used them everyday. I work in an office and I only put it to talk, so it’s not like I’m running with them. Please let me know can be done as I may have just gotten a defective one.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat them for the price
customer_reviews.text: The quality of these earbuds is pretty dang good for their cost. Sound quality is pretty good, and the microphone works well too. My only issue with these is they only seem to last me 3-4 months on average. Granted, I kind of abuse them, so I know that doesn't help their lifespan. I'd give them 5 stars if they lasted as long as other earbuds of this type that I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Some of the best earbuds I've had under $50. Yes they feel cheap but definitely aren't. I accidentally dropped these out of the car one day not noticing, then next morning I drove over them and it wasn't till I can back home till I realized they were on the ground. Still worked perfect. They have pretty good bass and nothing was distorted or muffled. Wish I could buy multiple pair
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Collaso

customer_reviews.title: Good base but sound leaks
customer_reviews.text: Good earphones for the price. The base is good. It doesn't amplify sound to an annoying levels like the Skullcandy Titans which I was afraid of. The quality of the wire is also good. They don't pop out of the ears like some of my earlier earphones. The only drawback is that if you are sitting in silent places like office or library and have been listening to songs with these earphones on, chances are that the person sitting next to you can hear the songs as well. This happens even if you are not at full volume. Other than that, these are good for the price range. Another good earphones for around $10 are Sony MDREX10LP/BLK In-Ear Headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Akshay

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: So, usually about every few months or so I get a new pair of earphones because of how much I use them. So as I kinda mentioned, they should probably last about four months without breaking or something, but as soon as I received these one of the head cap thingys came loose and detached from the thing it connects to with the wires still attached though. Usually, skullcandy brand is good quality and I like it for it’s quality sound and how comfortable it is, but you just have to look for the official skullcandy earphone brand, because sometimes it could possibly be copied and sold for the same price but low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Jasmine

customer_reviews.title: Candy sweet enough for the sale price
customer_reviews.text: The sound of the fake bass is a little difficult to adapt to, but they are the only buds I got for under $20 that made it through a month or more of my grave shift job. Usually a pair of JVCs would blow out on me or Sony's would just stop working on 1 side, but these have past the endurance check, although I doubt they'll last much longer under the constant pressure I put on earbuds. I should of bought multiple pairs during the sale.
customer_reviews.author: Robbydzwonar

customer_reviews.title: NOT IN GOOD SHAPE
customer_reviews.text: THEY PRODUCT ARRIVED IN ITS ORIGINAL UNOPENED PLASTIC HOUSING BUT THE CORDS WERE EXTREMELY HARD FOR SOME REASON AS IF THE PLASTIC HAD HARDENED IN THE SUN OR SOMETHING. ANYWAY ONLY ONE SIDE WORKS AND IT PRODUCES STATIC WHICH IS A CLEARLY A CONNECTION PROBLEM. GUESS THEY GOT ME, ONLY $10.00 ANYWAY GUESS THAT'S WHY, IT WILL PROBABLY COST YOU MORE TO RETURN THE ITEM. DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME., THE PRODUCT IS OLD DON'T FALL FOR THE SCAM.
customer_reviews.author: RAY10203

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: I've been using these headphones for years and absolutely love them. I think their sound is really nice and as long as you have your device on the proper EQ settings, the bass and balance is amazing. They're awesome at cancelling outside noise, I don't hear a thing most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The pair I thought I was getting are angled so that they more comfortably fit. I use these
customer_reviews.text: I have another set of these that I bought before and they are much longer than this set. Additionally, this set the pieces the silicon are attached to are different. This one they are attached at a right angle and go straight into your ear canal. The pair I thought I was getting are angled so that they more comfortably fit. I use these, they're not awful, but just not as good as the other pair.
customer_reviews.author: Nico!

customer_reviews.title: Earphone Review
customer_reviews.text: These were good for a while. I had bought some before but they broke after a while. For some reason these earphones mess up with my phone a lot now. It sometimes either brings the volume all the way up or all the way down. I dont know why it does this since you could only skip, pause, and play music with the button on the earphones. Im very confused why just now the problem started to happen. The sound and all works great just this issue of the song either blasting all the volume in my ear or turning down my favorite songs.
customer_reviews.author: Aldo R

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for low cost earbuds.
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite affordable earbuds. The best part is the controller in on the left string where it belongs. If you're only wearing it on one ear, it's most likely going to be on the left ear so the controller is still accessible. It's also really durable and doesn't give up on you until many months later. The jack is nice too because it's straight and grippy for ease of unplugging. I prefer the straight jacks as oppose to the L shaped ones that I've seen on other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and nearly disposable.
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality and excellent fit in the ears. The inline control only stops/plays or activates voice commands (no volume control), but you can't expect much from 10-15$ headphones. Great for the gym as you won't feel bad ripping them out of your ears by accident and the ear buds get a nice fit with the rubber caps. Lifespan is short under heavy use; I've gone through a few of these and one ear always goes dead before the other.
customer_reviews.author: Jace

customer_reviews.title: decent set of beater buds for roku 2 remote.
customer_reviews.text: decent set of beater buds for under $14 (now the are under $10). these are used in my roku 2 gen3 remote. i wanted some decently constructed buds that might last a year or so from close to daily abuse on the couch and coffee table as opposed to my old klipsch s4 assigned to desk duty only, which sound great with defined highs and lows (has some midrange) but the s4 are notorious for self destructing cords. these ink'd 2 buds are now burned-in over 100 hours. pros: + comes with mic + price (depending on how much) cons: - murky highs - murky mid range - no lows
customer_reviews.author: oloung1

customer_reviews.title: Good bass, fantastic buy!
customer_reviews.text: I use them for EVERYTHING! ive had then for 3 years and they still work like the day i bought them. Used on planes (great for drowning out babies and engine noise) and they are comfy enough for napping in. Enjoy the bass!
customer_reviews.author: aryn blase

customer_reviews.title: Best In-ear buds I've purchased in a long time
customer_reviews.text: Best In-ear buds I've purchased in a long time. I usually go for higher end quality (no not beats or Bose, real quality) but needed some beaters for work. I forgot how nice Skullcandy was for the price, definitely on the heavy base side but not to the point that they drown out vocals or instrumentals. The cord is a beautiful touch, if you're like me you tend to unplug and toss things around so the no tangling makes them a dream for work sites. If it had a volume rocker it would have been perfect, might need to get the newer pair once I kill these.
customer_reviews.author: miniaturegard3n

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, I will be back for more!
customer_reviews.text: Best wired earbuds for the price! I have purchased so many of these for myself and others. They can take a beating and sound great while doing it. If you can find a better product out there please send me a link, because in all my years I have not found one yet!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few pairs of these. They are the best. Sound quality is excellent and they stay snug in your ears.
customer_reviews.author: Mike C.

customer_reviews.title: Very dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have been using Skullcandy headphones for a long time. I like to haveI like to have an extra pair that actually an extra pair that actually fits into the phone because you never know when your Bluetooth battery going to die.
customer_reviews.author: janice M

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds lasted 3 weeks. Within the first week the left earbud stopped working half of the time. The second week the left ear completely stopped. Week three, where we are today, they completely went out. The sound quality is ok for the price, but the build quality is subpar. If you can, spend a few more dollars and buy something that lasts.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: One side of headphones broken upon delivery.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some headphones for my laptop that weren’t terrible quality and that weren’t extremely expensive. I chose to go with Skullcandy since I’ve had great experiences with their products in the past. Unfortunately, the pair I bought was already broken right out of the packaging.. The left side of the headphones were busted, so I only had sound in one side. I was extremely disappointed considering I love their products.. Going to have to try to get a replacement. Their products should not be broken INSIDE the package... I did not tamper or misuse these, as soon as I plugged it in to SEVERAL DEVICES, I confirmed that the headphones were at fault. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Macasaddu

customer_reviews.title: Not balanced sounds
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what's wrong with them, but the sound isn't balanced between the 2 buds. The left is slightly louder than the right. I tried them in multiple devices to be sure. Might be good if it weren't for that, but too hard to listen to.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Robesh

customer_reviews.title: It’s low key op
customer_reviews.text: This boy be good tho he obey you he make you feel the music he make you deaf 70%. I’m very impressed by this one, it’s very good. Sound is perfect for the price, it built with noise isolation not noise cancellation. But no worries that noise isolation is great I can barely hear people when I’m listening to music and little to no sound when not.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Great, Cheap, has in-line microphone
customer_reviews.text: My other skullcandy earphones finally broke after 3 years of use. Those didn't have the microphone in line so I wanted one that did. I got these for a good price on Amazon and the buds fit comfortably and the sound is good. (I'm not an audiophile but I appreciate good speakers and headphones). It is not bose noise-cancelling headphone quality sound, you will get some background noise leakage but it is good enough for my purposes (at the gym or running outdoors), plus now I can take calls without holding the phone to my ears. I'm not a fan of bluetooth earsets - you don't have to recharge these and they double as headphones.
customer_reviews.author: RNYCS

customer_reviews.title: Love skull candy
customer_reviews.text: We love skull candy in our house. We have tried the apple air pods and kinda hate them because they are uncomfortable, fall out easily and are not sound proof. We will go for the wireless skull candy for the next buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Sell people what they pay for the first time please
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought these same ones in the store about a year ago and these were not the same quality or material at all. This fealt very cheap. The left earbud was also not working when I took it out the package! I didint find the time to return them on time which is a mistake on my part. I wish they would have atleast sold me set of headphones that worked. Ordering electronics through amazon is always a hit or miss, usually a miss, which really sucks because I though a brand I trusted in the past would come out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT!!
customer_reviews.text: These pair of earbuds are completely fake. I got a real pair from my friend and they were absolutely amazing. The sound quality and base were incredible considering how small they were. I ended losing them and quickly wanted to replace them. THESE ARE DEFINITELY NOT REAL. They look similar from the photos on Amazon but in person you can distinguish the differences. They sounded like they were underwater and the base was horrible. Do yourself a favor and look for a different pair of earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Richie O.

customer_reviews.title: great sound,....poor build
customer_reviews.text: Have bought a few skullcandy sets because I am in love with the sound, bought these and another set on Aug 5th, i look after them like anyone valuing great sound would, but in all my efforts i have failed. Just above the headphone connector seems to have an issue, the sound is broken and distorted until you move the cable in that area, on both pair, manufacturer defect?? has to be. I cannot recommend these to anyone on the time frame they lasted me, but gave 2 stars for the sound quality they gave while they lasted. i guess you get what you pay for, i so wish they were better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Shannon M. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: I adore Skullcandy prodcut s
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these ear buds, especially for persons that utilize their smartphones for both digital music use, clear and concise phone conversations. The Skullcandy products always exceed my expectations, I utilize more than one set but as I said really like to use these for devices that I need to utilize not just great digital sound but also clear dependable conversations via smartphones, internet, google hangouts, and or any other way you may need to utilize a quality set of digital quality headphones with a built in microphone to use as needed with social media, phone, and smart phone use.
customer_reviews.author: ida zombie

customer_reviews.title: Definitely counterfeit but not terrible... They just feel cheap.
customer_reviews.text: These are not as good as the real Skullcandy's but they do the trick. They work okay but are definitely not as good of quality in both the feel and audio.
customer_reviews.author: Claudia Najera

customer_reviews.title: TRUE BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!
customer_reviews.text: Normal earphones will not stay in my ear so these are a quick and affordable alternative. Using them as I type and I am pleases with my purchase!!!
customer_reviews.author: PHOENIXXX

customer_reviews.title: Still a decent earbud for $11, but nowhere near ...
customer_reviews.text: Still a decent earbud for $11, but nowhere near as efficient as the previous generation Ink'd. They require roughly double the volume on my Macbook Pro to produce the same decibel levels as my old Ink'd, and the the bass response isn't as tight or accurate either. These don't fit my ear quite as well as the previous gen, too -- there's more plastic protruding downward from the earbud that prevents you from really setting these in snugly. In short, meh. Wish I could still get the 1st generation Ink'd.
customer_reviews.author: Jay D.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were crap. Broke in less then 2 weeks. This is the third pair from this seller that have broken in a short time. Not worth it. Pay a little more for better headphones. These seem like knockoffs.
customer_reviews.author: Spurling Family

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to leave iPhone when they come out with their no-jack version just because I like these so much
customer_reviews.text: These are absolutely my go-to. In fact, I'm going to leave iPhone when they come out with their no-jack version just because I like these so much. I have blue tooth as well, but these are much more comfortable. They are cheap, last a long time, and are easily replaced by the next pair. I had $80 ones that didn't perform as well and busted in 3 months. These are far superior.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY Worst headphones ever, NO MIC, CONSTANT STATIC, Looks fake
customer_reviews.text: Just spend few more bucks and get other ones. The product says it comes with a mic. Well it certainly looks like it doesnt. They have a constant static sound in them. THATS THE MOST ANNOYING PART. The sound quality is worse than the dollar headphones you might find. Very bad quality and finish. Look like they are fake headphones. have owned Inkd previously definitely they werent this bad. Returning these. No point in keeping them absolutely useless.
customer_reviews.author: Neha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Customer
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 pairs of these. They arrived in New packaging but when opening up it looked like they'd been repackaged (chord was all tangled and appeared to be shoved in the cable slot). The first pair lasted under 2 months before the right earbud went out. The second had bass in 1 ear and none in the other. The third has low quality in general. I've used skullcandy earbuds for working out for a long time, I'm very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AB88

customer_reviews.title: These are not the ear buds you are looking for...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for 8 months of 1-hour usage a day. Decent sound while they worked, nothing to write home about. One step above the OEM Apple ear bud. Ear bud on the side with the microphone stopped working. Did not yank it out nor submerge it with water. Just low quality build. Warranty is a joke too. Why would I want "store credit" toward another overpriced pair of ear buds? This product is not recommended - discontinued or not.
customer_reviews.author: TWofMD

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Great for working out especially running and it does last for a long time. It’s so nice especially compared to different earbuds and price
customer_reviews.author: Niraj sanyasi

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy Ink'd has been my go to iPod headphones for many years
customer_reviews.text: No reason to change now. High quality and a good price. The microphone is good for Facetime or other mobile video conversations
customer_reviews.author: Rachelle A.

customer_reviews.title: One had one ear that did not work. Other pair broke first week.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two. They broke the first week. One did not work right out of the pkg. Normally use this brand and pay much more. These had to be seconds or from a bad batch. Save the headache and pay the normal price.
customer_reviews.author: JustMe

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones, OK mic
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price, and the only downside is that I have to sometimes hold the mic a little closer to be heard. I always have problems with mics picking me up (Xbox 360 headsets, PC headsets, handset speakerphones... you name it, I'm too soft-spoken or something). These things do the job I need them to though, and they sound good doing it. They're durable too - I've accidentally stood up while these are plugged into my laptop, ran over them with my office chair, and you can't tell a bit. They should be broken and gross, but they're not.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: READ BEFORE PURCHASE
customer_reviews.text: At first they were pretty good, good sound quality. However, about a week after purchase, the cover for the volume control came off, and followed by two weeks later the entire volume control unit popped in half.. Good sound quality, not great quality in general. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Christy Ann

customer_reviews.title: Good headphones
customer_reviews.text: Good quality sound and bass, noise cancelling(could actually be too cancelling at times), would not reccomend while biking or being a pedestrian as they can be distracting. Plus the button is the only non water resistant part that can break if wet. They last a good 5-6 months if used semi-lightly which is really good for the price. Plus they tend to fall out during workouts or jogging. Would reccomend for studying and long car rides (not when you're driving obviously).
customer_reviews.author: Liam Garrity

customer_reviews.title: Great esrbuds
customer_reviews.text: So far no issues. I like the way fit, the sound is good. Once in awhile theres feedback when talking on it. And it may have been the other person. Its still a good pair of earbuds. I would recommend these
customer_reviews.author: Donna

customer_reviews.title: great!!
customer_reviews.text: I have incredibly small ears and have issues with earbuds falling out. These don't, even on my runs! Overall, this is a fantastic product. My skullcandy earbuds always serve me well for about three years! I'm excited to see how these pan out
customer_reviews.author: Emily Huffman

customer_reviews.title: nice, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: So the headphones themselves are really durable, nice, comfortable, comes with 2 sizes of earbuds that you can switch between. Problem is, it comes in one of those really hard to open plastic plastic packaging that could probably survive bush shears and clippers. This is much better than the apple headphones that you get with the Iphone models. I bought 2 of them but during my time with it, it has successfully survives wear and tear, with anything from boxes to heavy tables pulling on the cord. Great product
customer_reviews.author: Mingyi Zou

customer_reviews.title: Get Amazon earbuds instead
customer_reviews.text: These are nice for around a couple months until they break. The sound quality is quite nice but since they're so flimsy, repurchasing them is such a pain and it adds up. I prefer any generic brand on Amazon that are already well-reviewed.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Feng

customer_reviews.title: Random breakage? WTH?
customer_reviews.text: I’ve use these earbuds less than 15 times and the microphone that is attached to the cord randomly (and I do mean randomly) broke while I held them in my hand! I love the Skullcandy Ink’d sound quality and how well they fit my ears. However, after this latest episode, I have to recant my +10 year advocacy for Skullcandy and their products. 😔
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these headphones
customer_reviews.text: The quality and the durability of them still amazes me, will get another one if the current ones fail or something.
customer_reviews.author: B Collado

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying...my teenager is HARD on earbuds. Everytime I turn around, it seems were buying new ones. It gets annoying (and expensive) so I am happy to leave a good review for these because they are still working and have most definitely taken a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for hands free
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well so far. I tend to get the wires caught on stuff when I'm cleaning. My hubby occasionally uses his for music or talking on the phone in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Holly Lace-dye

customer_reviews.title: Headphones and mic sound great, but I bought two pairs of these in ...
customer_reviews.text: Headphones and mic sound great, but I bought two pairs of these in April 2013 and neither of them are working as of 11/15/2014. I purchased 6 of these on the same day (2 black, 2 green and 2 blue) so my children and I would each have two for a backup. None of them are working. In most cases one side of the headset stops working. In the case of the green ones, both of them just stopped working completely. I tested them in other devices and it was the earbuds not working. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding headphones for Electronic music lovers
customer_reviews.text: I just love the Ink'd 2.0. I am using them as in-ear monitors for singers, and for personal listening pleasure. It's got some serious bass response, and it's got crisp clean sound. The price is incredible if you ask me. The only issue is when you turn them up too high - they start to lose the bass response and highs take over. That's normal however, for most headphones. Thing is, the Ink'd 2.0 reproduce sound louder than stock iPhone headphones for example, so you won't need to go higher than 90% where it starts to go crazy when using an iDevice.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Lasted a month
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve been buying these Skull Candy earphones for at least five years now. I like that they stay in your ears during work outs. The sound quality is good. The overall quality seems to be trash nowadays though. The first pair I bought lasted close to two years. The last pair just over one month before they fell apart. These things are completely disposable.
customer_reviews.author: drewij

customer_reviews.title: Still An Imitation...
customer_reviews.text: They're good quality and work just fine, however, they're not actual Skullcandy ear buds.. I got the same pair a few months ago from a different supplier and that pair was a LOT higher quality. The plastic was better, the speakers were thinner, made of actual metal and the sound quality was way more bass-y (if that's a word). These are pretty good, they have clear sound, have nothing wrong with them and you probably wouldn't even notice if you're not super picky about sound quality like I am, but they're still a clear imitation of actual Skullcandy ear buds, even the logo is different. In short, good product, but still an imitation...
customer_reviews.author: AlphaMoon

customer_reviews.title: Recommend for wired headphones!
customer_reviews.text: I really like these and have used them for years now. In June, I bought a couple sets for my 17 y/o boys’s birthday. They like them because they can use them “all day” and there’s no worries about a charge running out. These were delivered promptly and in perfect condition.
customer_reviews.author: Nic

customer_reviews.title: Broke
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a trip. The wire inside broke and the sound no longer worked. End up throwing them away and using a free pair I got. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kyla

customer_reviews.title: Skull Candy headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones love this brand will never use anything else they are loud and good bass highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Works Great! ...For a Month
customer_reviews.text: The audio and mic quality are fair, so I wanted to like these earbuds. Actually, I just wanted them to last longer than a month, but they decided to start cutting out in one ear shortly after the return window ends. Wonderful. :) I've had problems with Skullcandy before but I was at least hoping to get half a year out of these before having to replace them. Now I won't be going back to this brand at all.
customer_reviews.author: S. J.

customer_reviews.title: These are the best earbuds that you can buy
customer_reviews.text: I always get Skullcandy headphone earbuds they are the best with their sound quality I always hear nice clear sound as well as bass in them and they have surround sound so I can't hear anything else but what I'm listening to it is awesome as just anybody to buy them it's a good bang for your buck
customer_reviews.author: Jakecu

customer_reviews.title: Overall a GOOD product
customer_reviews.text: Overall the Skullcandy Ink'd 2 earbuds are a great pair of earbuds. The sound is great and is comparable to the sound quality of the new Apple earbuds that come with each new iPhone. The earbuds have great bass and all subtle sounds from songs are clearly audible. They fit comfortably in the ear (comes with a pair of large gel earbud sleeves and a pair of small gel earbud sleeves). For the price you aren't going to find a better sounding pair of earbuds. My only concern is that they break or stop working after about 3 months of use (one side will stop working usually). Other people who I have talked to have had similar problems. 4/5
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are the best!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best sounding earbuds I have gotten so far, I listen to lots of audio books, and these have the best sound quality and have lasted the longest so far. This is my second pair, my first pair I am still using, just reordered so that I had another pair if the first pair got damaged, I am rough on them, and they get tangled up on stuff, when i am wearing them, especially if I only have one in my ear. When I do listen to music with them, its great sound! I also use them when making phone calls, people say the ear me just fine. I would recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Dea

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality, break easily
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! I do like the sound quality of Skullcandy headphones but these broke right after the window in which I was able to send them back. I keep buying these because of the price but it is my experience that they never last long. I think it's time for me to invest the money in quality headphones, not these cheaply made ones.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Use these daily about 12 hours a day and usually last about 10-12 months. The sound quality is great and the are comfortable to wear.
customer_reviews.author: Kim C

customer_reviews.title: Reliable sound
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We usually buy skullcandy, never disappointed. My kids just lose them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: lil_delfin

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: Only had headsets for 3 months and was unable to hear through them. Was unable to return them since return window closed. :(
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Gallad

customer_reviews.title: Sound like they cost... Cheap.
customer_reviews.text: They sound good for the price. Unfortunately they only sound good with rap and bass heavy dub. The frequency response is way too harsh for rock or heavy metal. They sound cheap no warmth around 200hz and super huge spike at like 2.5k and 5k makes for a cheap harsh sound.
customer_reviews.author: Braden Larsen

customer_reviews.title: Not too bad for a budget pair of headphones
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for a few months now and I have to say they work pretty much just 'okay'. They are my back up headphones/mic for my iphone as I still prefer the original that came with the phone. I do like how they stay in the ears better, but sound quality on both the headphones and the mic is only just meh. The cord is extra long which can be handy, and the cord texture and shape doesn't lead it to get tangled easy, so that is a plus. For a budget pair of headphones, not too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Great Bass
customer_reviews.text: I give this 5 stars because of how well the bass is compared to the aftermarket Apple earphones. I haven't had them for a while, so I can't say much about the durability, but I must say, this shipped fast. I ordered around midnight Tuesday, and I got it today Wednesday afternoon. My only issue is the mic feature as I don't use this with my phone, so it does get in the way, but they work great. If you have an issue with them falling out, try switching to the smaller earpiece. I did that and it resolved my issue with them falling out.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hu

customer_reviews.title: Not very good.
customer_reviews.text: They last maybe 1-3 months and sound quality in't very good. If you're looking for a fulfilling long-term relationship then these aren't the earbuds for you. I'd suggest dropping the extra cash for some higher quality earbuds. The extra money will be worth it and it'll probably end up the cheaper option in the end because you won't have to keep replacing these dang diddly things every 1-3 months. (But hey if you're not looking for commitment and just need something to get you through the next couple of weeks these will do just fine.)
customer_reviews.author: Becca Saulnier

customer_reviews.title: It's not ink'd 2.0 it old version
customer_reviews.text: It wasn't ink'd 2.0 it was just the old version just plan ink'd and contact info given is not the sellers info they are scaming people and sending out of date things
customer_reviews.author: Master

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrible. Moved to review this due to these recently becoming unusable. These broke in a little over a month with only moderate use. The sound on one side is totally gone and simply stopped functioning. The attached microphone didn't work and the earbuds were both designated for the right ear. What's more, they're terrible if you use them for gaming. You have no idea what direction anything I'd coming from due to the sound not being precise with contextual positioning. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. If you must budget and can't afford premium price for earbuds/headphones, there are much better alternatives out there. Stay away and save your money. You've been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Zero

customer_reviews.title: Would have been a great buy... If both ears worked
customer_reviews.text: I picked up my head phones on the way to the gym and from the first try until today the left earbud decides to work only 5% of the time. Headphones seem like they could have been quality otherwise but only having half the requirements to use isn't worth it. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sutton-daniels

customer_reviews.title: Sound quality sucks!
customer_reviews.text: These don't have that much bass in them and the sound quality isn't that good like the rest of the skullcandy ones and I've been using skullcandy for years now..
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Even with multiple style options, these fall out continually. It is a shame because they look great visually.
customer_reviews.text: These do not fit my daughter's ears... or mine. I love Skull candy, conceptually very cool but if you are jogging or fast walking keeping these in your ears is impossible. I spend more time adjusting them and keeping them in and less time losing myself in my run. Kills the purpose. Maybe it is just me, and my daughter... but I will stick with the factory provided ear bud's which have never given me an issue. Very well crafted however, and they look great so I will give them 3 stars based on that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S. Sausville

customer_reviews.title: I have had several pairs of skullcandy headphones over the years and they were all great. I opened these yesterday and there is a ...
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviews have stated, I don't think these are real skullcandy headphones. I have had several pairs of skullcandy headphones over the years and they were all great. I opened these yesterday and there is a buzzing sound that comes from them whenever you plug them in. Also when you play music through them the volume gets louder and quieter every few seconds. I am returning them and will buy a pair from a store. Also when I purchased these they said they were sold through Skullcandy, but when I went to return them the seller information said Kar Wah. Im not sure why it says this but I would not suggest ordering through this link.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Button breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I've bought 3 pairs of these over the years. The microphone/button has broken on the last 2 pair. The plastic cover piece has cracked and eventually fallen off. I don't recall what happened to the first pair, but they're in the trash somewhere. Probably not buying Skullcandy again because of these issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, not for use as a car handsfree
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to serve me as a handsfree for my Nexus 4. They are awesome as headphones with a nice bass and great sound, and the microphone is decent at least, however they provide way too much insulation, regardless of the buds that you're using. If you plan on using them as both headphones for music and a handsfree while you're walking, jogging and everything else, they are a prime choice for the price, however when you're driving they stop too much of the outside sound for a safe drive
customer_reviews.author: Alin-Alexandru Turlac

customer_reviews.title: Unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Not happy with these at all I previously had skull candy headphones for almost ten years and they just broke which is why I pour chased these. They don't seem to work properly.... The noise coming out is scratchy there is no bass at all like my other scull candy headphones. These seem like a cheaply made knock off. I am not using them because they hurt my ears. Also came in just a glorified plastic bag, no label, nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ciara

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses these while he is mowing the lawn. He says they work very good
customer_reviews.author: Karen B

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 Issue
customer_reviews.text: I did quite a bit of research and these head phones kept coming up as one of the better bangs for the buck. After using them for about 6 months I have to agree that they offer great sound quality, the cord is rather flexible and the Mic actually works with my Android. The One Problem: They are a metal housing. That means every time I roll in my office chair I get zapped(Static Shock) in the ear. It's a little annoying, since I'm stuck at a desk all day. I put a wrap of electrical tape around them and they work great. Other than that I am very happy with these head phones.
customer_reviews.author: I. Haas

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several pairs of these headphones over the years and let me share my experiences. Pros: - Good sound quality - Decent price - Nice player controller - buds fit nicely - The flat cable does help prevent tangles a little Cons: - The wires in headphone jack are the first to break - The earbud break off next - The contacts on the jack wear out quickly - the longest they last from normal use is about 1.5 years These ear buds are good but I think I won't be buying anymore of them. They're good for a while but if you're looking for headphones to last, these aren't it.
customer_reviews.author: runwords

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to receive this headphones because I had them before and Skullcandy head phone are actually really good, they do their job just basic headphones that work. By reading the review I thought to my self "great now I can listen to music or watch video at work during my lunch break with out bothering anyone" I was wrong first thing the packing of the product was in a little baggy. second they didn't work! One side of the headphone didn't work. I was so mad I should just bought at store
customer_reviews.author: Liza

customer_reviews.title: on point worth $10
customer_reviews.text: i bought these because i had the same pair 7 years ago and they bump just as i remember idk what peeps are compLaining about i havent had an issue with them and for $10 what more do you want ??!! they bump and noise canceL for $10 worth any day
customer_reviews.author: MaBallzItch

customer_reviews.title: Good sound, but not super durable
customer_reviews.text: Good sound quality, but they seem to suddenly stop working. I have had one side stop working for no reason, no rough treatment, sometimes they even stopped working while I was wearing them. I have used them for a long time with only one side that works, the remote still seems to work even if the headphone on that side stops working. I have had 3 or 4 pairs of these, because they are not too durable, but they are comfortable and I like the remote.
customer_reviews.author: A mom in Nebraska

customer_reviews.title: Ok - but not Skull Candy's usual standard
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it is the skull candy or my son, but we have been through several sets of these in the last 6 months, each had a different kind of problem (ie, only one side works, bud comes unattached, cord frays quickly etc.). Keep buying more because never had problems with this brand before and thought they were aberrations. However, after the third pair I believe it is a quality control issue.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Good quality! They fall out of your ears a little easier than expected, but great sound quality!
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and durability
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds for the price are the best I've had. They just don't die!
customer_reviews.author: SarahG221

customer_reviews.title: They're great at work because they block out noise and don't ...
customer_reviews.text: These earbuds have been very reliable for me in the past. They're great at work because they block out noise and don't disturb others around me, and I can take calls with them using the microphone. HOWEVER, the left earbud no longer produces sound after only 4 months. I am extremely disappointed in the product and will look for a different brands as I look for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Kurtz

customer_reviews.title: Not good for exercise, great for cummutes
customer_reviews.text: These headphones have good sound quality and are great for regular everyday use such as commuting on the train or bus, watching videos and movies on your smartphone or tablet. However, I don't recommend that you use them while exercising. Whether you're biking, running, or lifting weights, these headphones have the tendency to slip out and require constant adjustment. Also, they're not that durable. After about a month of regular use while exercising, the left year bud's sound has become quieter than the right. i'm assuming it's because sweat got in there and messed with the internal components.
customer_reviews.author: Belal Khan

customer_reviews.title: Simple headphones
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. A simple set of reliable headphones.
customer_reviews.author: MaKenna Ort

customer_reviews.title: Skullcandy rocks!!!
customer_reviews.text: Skullcandy has the best earbuds by far. I haven't found any with a better sound.
customer_reviews.author: Koates

customer_reviews.title: These headphones were perfect for the first three months
customer_reviews.text: These headphones were perfect for the first three months, but now the audio goes in and out all the time. I can't seem to find a loose connection anywhere, but as I walk everything sounds stuttered.(I've checked it on other devises as well) They still work well if I'm sitting still and not moving - but thats never the case. Unfortunately I'm going to have to toss these and look into another option.
customer_reviews.author: Evann Borgman

customer_reviews.title: Could be A LOT better
customer_reviews.text: Functions could be better. Button only works to start Svoice (I have a galaxy s4, for my ipod it will start siri) or end a call. It will not change the song, pause the song or video, etc. Just very basic functions. As for the sound quality, this is one of those headphones where everyone around you can listen to what you're listening too, even if you don't have the volume all the way up. I had expected more from SkullCandy.
customer_reviews.author: mariavictoria

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Skullcandy earbuds. My first pair (1.0) stopped working properly after about 2 years. Intermittent problem probably from being forced into my pockets/armband. I run a couple of times a week and these have been so useful! I loved them so much I stuck with skullcandy for my second pair. I love the size of the earbuds, I have small ear canals and these fit great, though they come with different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Di Hickman

customer_reviews.title: Love them!!
customer_reviews.text: I order a new set every year. I love these. I use them 10 hours a day, 6 days a week in a machine shop. It drowns out all other noise and sound great!
customer_reviews.author: LrccJoker

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These things are great. They fit me well, sound amazing for what they are, indestructible, cheap, and don't tangle. Probably sent these thru the washer half a dozen times with no effect on them. Still sound great, even if they been submerged over and over. Couldn't recommend anything else close to as good as these are let alone at the price level they sell them at. Had a number of in ear headphones before, but I'll never buy anything else again.
customer_reviews.author: Divus

customer_reviews.title: My Search May Be Over...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a few headphones from different providers looking for good sound and durability. All my previous headphones couldn't survive my daily exercise... walking. The cords would fray and the sound for both music and phone calls would become annoyingly noisy with static. So far these skullcandy are holding up to simple walking without crying uncle and being sent to headphone heaven. It's still early but so far so good. Right now I would say good quality for a good price
customer_reviews.author: michael thomas

product_meta.title: Skullcandy Ink'd 2.0 Mic'd Ear Bud Headphone (Black)
product_meta.description: Skullcandy is a company that markets headphones, earphones, hands free devices, audio backpacks, MP3 players, and other products. The company was founded in 2003. Skullcandy's products are targeted at the outdoor action sports demographic (snowboarders, skateboarders, etc.) and general consumer market. Skullcandy embodies exclusive designs by some of today's most notorious artists, fused with team-inspired state-of-the-art technology in both function and form, remixed to a thumping beat. Leaving an undisputed mark on critics and believers alike, this popular bud has been re-shaped, re-tuned and re-produced for true fans. Complete with Supreme Sound, the Ink'd 2 is a remix worth hearing for yourself. - Supreme Sound delivers Attacking Bass, Natural Vocals and Precision Highs. Flattened cable for style and durability - Designed, engineered and manufactured by Skullcandy - THD: less than 0.1% (1mW/500Hz) - Cable Type: TPE. Sound Pressure Level: 85 dB (1mW/500Hz) (85.3).
feature_bullets: SUPREME SOUND: Ink'd 2 features Supreme Sound technology producing attacking, powerful bass, warm, natural vocals, and precision highs.
FLAT CABLE: The ultra-durable flat cable decreases nasty tangles and provides a unique look that is built to last.
ONE-BUTTON REMOTE AND MIC: A single button in-line remote with mic can take and make calls, play and pause music and cycle through tracks.
FIT YOUR STYLE: With unique color options, you can add a splash of individuality to your listening experience.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars4,789 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
